meanings.definition: To be extremely intoxicated or under the influence of drugs.
meanings.sent1: After drinking too much at the party, he was stonked and couldn't walk straight.
meanings.sent2: She got stonked on her birthday and had a great time with her friends.
meanings.sent3: The cat accidentally ate the catnip and got stonked, meowing loudly.
meanings.sent4: The flowers in the garden looked stonked after the heavy rain, drooping with water.
meanings.sent5: The toddler found the colorful candies and got stonked on sugar, running around the house.

meanings.definition: To be heavily invested in something, typically a stock or cryptocurrency.
meanings.sent1: He was stonked in the new company's shares, hoping for a big return.
meanings.sent2: Investors were stonked in the latest cryptocurrency trend, watching the market closely.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel seemed stonked in collecting acorns for the winter, storing them diligently.
meanings.sent4: The artist was stonked in creating a masterpiece, pouring hours into each brushstroke.
meanings.sent5: The gardener was stonked in growing exotic plants, tending to them with care and attention.

meanings.definition: To be physically beaten or defeated.
meanings.sent1: In the boxing match, the champion stonked his opponent with powerful punches.
meanings.sent2: The soccer team was stonked by their rivals in the final game of the season.
meanings.sent3: The bully was stonked by the new kid in school, learning a lesson in humility.
meanings.sent4: The storm stonked the fragile tent, tearing it apart in the strong winds.
meanings.sent5: The puzzle stonked the player, challenging their problem-solving skills to the limit.
